Text on 5 straight lines. Along the left border of the plaque, from top to bottom, a star made of three intersecting segments and a pitcher from which comes a staurogram flanked by A and Ω. At the end of the text, on the lower right corner of the plaque, a Greek cross flanked by two doves facing each other.

Text on 7 straight lines, pronounced guidelines, horizontal and vertical, also used for framing the epigraphic field. On the right side of the plaque, a staurogram at the end of the fourth line and a palm branch closes the text at the end of the seventh line.
A with broken crossbar. Rubricated letters, engraved with a wide and deep groove.

Text on 7 straight lines; rubricated letters, guidelines visible.
Line 2: possible cursive H in ἔζησε, read as I by Orsi; line 3: in the first M it is clearly visible the first draft of a lunate sigma, subsequently corrected by the stonecutter.
